summary: Email correspondence between two individuals, likely within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, regarding a civilian crime report received from someone in Australia. The report references Maxwell (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) but appears unconnected to the case, and includes thumb drives which are being passed on for review.

persons.name: Deputy Chief, Criminal Division Southern District of New York
persons.context: Sender of the email forwarding a civilian crime report and thumb drives received from Australia, referencing Maxwell, to the recipient.

events.title: Civilian Crime Report from Australia
events.description: A letter and thumb drives are received from someone in Australia making a civilian crime report that references Maxwell (likely Ghislaine Maxwell), but appears to have no connection to the case.
personsInvolved: Deputy Chief, Criminal Division Southern District of New York

keyFacts: A civilian crime report was received from someone in Australia in October 2022, referencing Maxwell (likely Ghislaine Maxwell).
The report included thumb drives, which were not examined by the initial recipient and were passed on for further review.
The correspondence indicates standard practice for handling such unsolicited materials in the U.S. Attorney's Office.
The document suggests ongoing public interest and unsolicited tips related to the Epstein/Maxwell case years after the main prosecutions.
